answers.answer: not a single reply? is this a fake site?
It is possible that it was human error.  Hopefully it is nothing.  My first was only 6 lbs. I am not sure how big this one is, but I have only ever measured right on. Good luck.
It can vary depending upon which way baby is positioned in your tummy too.

Could be big baby. Or God forbid diabetes. They say babies with leaps in growth spurts may have mom with gestational diabetes. Too much amniotic fluid. This is a real site but most moms won't answer if they don't have an answer.

Baby position can also change the fundal height some.  But also big baby but not always.  In was 40cm at 40 wks with my son and he was 10# 2 oz.  My other son i was a few weeks a head forget now almost 8 yrs ago but they thought he was 9 lbs at 36 wks and was born on his due date and was 7# 12 oz.  really you won't know for sure till the babies are born.  I one week a head now with this one and thinking we have a 9 ish baby. Doesn't feel as heavy as my 10+ # baby but will see I how it not a 10# this time .

question: hi new hereare there any other reasons or conditions that would explain a sudden high fundal height measurement. other than big baby of course or humam errormy boy has been at the top of the charts all along my pregnancy so i expected a bigish baby. my daughter was also big at 9lb5had a growth scan at 34 weeks and yhey estimated he was 6lb. but in the 2 weeks since then hes jumped off the charts and the midwife seemed very worried so i have to go see the consultant next weeki was wondering if there was any explanation for a fundal height measurement to jump so much in so little time when hes been following the 85percentile curve to the dot every week up till nowthanks
title: fundal height 43cm at 36 weeks
